title: Business Development Representative
description: About Turing Based in Palo Alto, California, Turing is the world's first AI-powered tech services company. It has reimagined tech services from the ground up with AI by offering AI-vetted and matched talent, AI-accelerated development, and access to AI transformation experts who have built many of the most iconic Silicon Valley companies. Founded in 2018, the company has experienced tremendous growth with three million global developers on its Talent Cloud and 900+ clients. Turing has received numerous awards, including Forbes 's 2022 "One of America's Best Startup Employers," being ranked #1 in The Information 's 2021 Annual List of most promising B2B Companies and Fast Company 's "Annual List of the World's Most Innovative Companies." The company's leadership team comprises both AI technologists from leading organizations including Meta, Google, Microsoft, Apple, Amazon, Twitter, Stanford, Caltech, MIT as well as tech consulting veterans from Accenture, Cognizant, Capgemini, McKinsey, Bain, and more. About role: The Business Development Representative identifies and negotiates strategic relationships with current customers and develops new business relationships. Responsibilities: Prospects for potential new clients within our target market: Enterprise business ($1B+ in revenue) looking for Tech Services suppliers Cold Calls to prospective new clients as well as new buying centers within current clients. Follow up and qualify sales leads. Strategizes and executes outreach efforts to connect with buyers who may not be aware of Turing. Makes professional presentations on Turing's capabilities to help solve client problems. Develops and maintains relationships with key customer personnel. Identifies client needs. Provides product/solutions data as needed by customers. Creates opportunities for AEs to work towards closing. Works with Sales AEs and Pod Leads to grow the business. Completes internal reports and paperwork in a timely fashion. Documents all activities within SalesForce CRM Requirements: A minimum of 2 years of experience in professional-level business-to-business sales. A proven track record of successful sales into a technical buying audience (CIO, CTO, IT departments, Software Engineering, etc). Strong cold-calling and relationship-building skills. Excellent presentation and negotiation abilities. Self-motivated with a results-driven mindset. Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a dynamic start-up environment. A strong knowledge of how enterprise corporations buy their products and services Willingness and ability to travel occasionally to events to meet clients/prospects in person. Strong computer skills including knowledge of Google Workspace. Knowledge of SalesForce or other CRM system Advantages of joining Turing: Amazing work culture (Super collaborative & supportive work environment; 5 days a week) Awesome colleagues (Surround yourself with top talent from Meta, Google, LinkedIn etc. as well as people with deep startup experience) Competitive compensation Flexible working hours Full-time remote opportunity Don't meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. Turing is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristics. At Turing we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace and celebrate authenticity, so if you're excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles. For applicants from the European Union, please review Turing's GDPR notice here.

title: Business Development Specialist
description: HelpNotificationsMessagesinfo@seilertucker.comStart of main content Edit the job postJob post has missing information To improve this post, add information that’s important to people applying.Add Job details Job titleBusiness Development SpecialistCompany for this jobSeiler TuckerNumber of openings 1 Country and language United States English LocationNew Orleans, LA 70130Job type Full-time ScheduleAdd optional informationPayFrom $40,000.00 per year Tip: Increase your pay to be competitive Update your pay to $58,801.00 - $64,644.00 per year to stand out. Jobs having competitive salaries are 38% more likely to report a hire by day 7.* UpdateEditShow DataTravel requirementAdd optional informationSupplemental pay types Commission pay Bonus opportunities BenefitsAdd optional information Tip: Use competitive benefits The benefits below are competitive and commonly used across similar Business Development Specialist jobs in New Orleans, LA on Indeed. Health insurance Dental insurance Paid time off 401(k) Vision insurance UpdateEditJob description Job description – Business Development Specialist Seiler Tucker Inc. is an innovative Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A) firm that leverages new technologies and innovation to expedite the selling process power client business. With a proven track record of 23 years successfully selling hundreds of businesses, Seiler Tucker Inc. is a dynamic and fast-paced company that is revolutionizing the M&A industry. The founder, Michelle Seiler Tucker M&AMI, CSBA, CM&AP, CBB, is a WSJ, is a WSJ and USA Today best-selling author of the book “Exit Rich” and an international keynote speaker. Seiler Tucker Inc. is seeking a Business Development Specialist to join our dynamic team. This role is ideal for individuals with a passion for business growth and a knack for developing lucrative business opportunities. The primary responsibilities of a business development specialist will be to prospect for new opportunities, engage new and existing clients who wish to either buy or sell a business, offer clients a range of services including evaluations, business coaching, software, artificial intelligence (AI), and other M&A services. The ideal candidate should have a minimum of 5 years of Business Development working with B2B businesses, display great people skills, know how finding and incorporating new technologies, manage sales pipelines from lead generation to closing 6-7 figure + deals, business expansion into new locations, creating profit centers with congruent revenue streams, networking for alliances and partnerships, and have 3 years minimum business experience particularly in high level sales (6-7 Figure +) with long sales cycles. Business Development Specialist Responsibilities: Develop and implement effective business development strategies to attract new clients and retain existing ones. Nation-wide Office Expansion Experience incorporating new technologies into developing new business Experience Starting new profit centers and congruent revenue streams Forming alliances and new partnerships Identify clients/potential partners in which to expand M&A services Build and maintain strong relationships with business sellers and buyers and third-party vendors ensuring exceptional customer service throughout the business transaction process. Setting up and organizing events Collaborate with marketing, sales, financial analyst, and operations teams to create compelling sales materials. Manage the full sales cycle, from lead generation to closing deals, while consistently meeting or exceeding sales targets. Attend industry events and networking opportunities to promote the company and stay informed about market trends. Maintain accurate and current records of all sales activities and client interactions using CRM tools. Work closely with financial analysts, buyers, and sellers to facilitate successful transactions. Discover patentable opportunities Business Development Specialist Requirements: Experience in M&A, business brokerage, or related fields highly preferred. At least 5 years of consecutive business development and sales experience, preferably in B2B environments. Proven track record in high-level business development and sales (6-7 figure + deals). Exceptional negotiation, communication, and interpersonal skills. Building congruent revenue streams Business expansion and new office start-up Nation-wide Office Expansion Experience incorporating new technologies in Experience Starting new profit centers and congruent revenue streams Forming alliances and new partnerships Strong organizational skills with extreme attention to detail. Ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team. Familiarity with CRM practices and ability to manage sales pipelines effectively. Willingness/Ability to travel minimally, as required. title: Optimization Manager
description: Known for being a great place to work and build a career, KPMG provides audit, tax and advisory services for organizations in today’s most important industries. Our growth is driven by delivering real results for our clients. It’s also enabled by our culture, which encourages individual development, embraces an inclusive environment, rewards innovative excellence and supports our communities. With qualities like those, it’s no wonder we’re consistently ranked among the best companies to work for by Fortune Magazine, Consulting Magazine, Working Mother Magazine, Diversity Inc. and others. If you’re as passionate about your future as we are, join our team. KPMG is currently seeking a Manager, Price Optimization Strategy to join our Growth and Strategy organization. Responsibilities: Support the pricing value-based and offer configuration programs, critical to managing our overall firmwide efforts to transition away from time & material pricing and deliver value-oriented market strategies which includes content creation and management, overseeing the value benefit analytics process, managing the overall conversion effort, x-functional stakeholder alignment, x-functional team leadership Assist in the engagement-level deal modeling and financial schedules for performance based pricing, subscription SaaS pricing models and other alternative pricing methods; follow the direction of the Pricing & Commercial Enablement organization, responsible for leading function and service unit leadership through the strategic plans and processes; prepare content for Function leaders, Management Committee consumption and other executive leadership communications Contribute to product vision & roadmap; help with the evaluation of pricing/CPQ vendor solutions and overall architecture Engage in stakeholder workshops to understand current state and explore future state, capture functional requirements, design and present concepts, design processes, workflows and UX, conduct usability testing, develop technical specifications, support development/configuration teams, develop test plans and scripts, support deployment approach Lead the definition of pricing optimization and solution attributes, in conjunction with Functional stakeholders and SMEs; manage price optimization modeling and maintenance Qualifications: Minimum five years of recent experience in professional services in a strategic pricing role or related field as well as experience in a business analyst role, preferably one that affects sales behaviors such as pricing, business development, marketing, or sales enablement Bachelor of Art or Science degree from an accredited college/university is required; preferably CPP, MBA or MA Experience with designing and implementing systems that affect sales behavior, such as CRM, SFA, CPQ, Quote-to-Cash; experience with the Salesforce platform, design approach, configuration and integration; revenue Cloud/CPQ is a major plus Experience implementing pricing technologies, either internally built or leveraging a third party provider; experience in developing solution/product visions and specifications, facilitating stakeholder workshops; keen attention to detail and willingness to respectfully challenge group think in pursuit of strategic objectives; ability to engage and interact with, technical, non-technical, offshore and third party vendor staff; strong problem-solving, communication and inter-personal skills Hands on experience in defining solution attribution-based price optimization models and executing the process to elicit requirements, develop functional solutions, design system workflows/UX in Salesforce or related third party solutions, support development resources, prepare test plans, and support deployment and change management plans General knowledge of data technologies, including Business Intelligence, Machine Learning, Predictive Analytics, Artificial Intelligence, and how they can be leveraged in an application and UX design; excellent skills in Microsoft Office Suite including Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook, Teams; experience with SAP or other ERP billing systems a plus KPMG complies with all local/state regulations regarding displaying salary ranges. title: Optimization Manager
description: Known for being a great place to work and build a career, KPMG provides audit, tax and advisory services for organizations in today’s most important industries. Our growth is driven by delivering real results for our clients. It’s also enabled by our culture, which encourages individual development, embraces an inclusive environment, rewards innovative excellence and supports our communities. With qualities like those, it’s no wonder we’re consistently ranked among the best companies to work for by Fortune Magazine, Consulting Magazine, Working Mother Magazine, Diversity Inc. and others. If you’re as passionate about your future as we are, join our team. KPMG is currently seeking a Manager, Price Optimization Strategy to join our Growth and Strategy organization. Responsibilities: Support the pricing value-based and offer configuration programs, critical to managing our overall firmwide efforts to transition away from time & material pricing and deliver value-oriented market strategies which includes content creation and management, overseeing the value benefit analytics process, managing the overall conversion effort, x-functional stakeholder alignment, x-functional team leadership Assist in the engagement-level deal modeling and financial schedules for performance based pricing, subscription SaaS pricing models and other alternative pricing methods; follow the direction of the Pricing & Commercial Enablement organization, responsible for leading function and service unit leadership through the strategic plans and processes; prepare content for Function leaders, Management Committee consumption and other executive leadership communications Contribute to product vision & roadmap; help with the evaluation of pricing/CPQ vendor solutions and overall architecture Engage in stakeholder workshops to understand current state and explore future state, capture functional requirements, design and present concepts, design processes, workflows and UX, conduct usability testing, develop technical specifications, support development/configuration teams, develop test plans and scripts, support deployment approach Lead the definition of pricing optimization and solution attributes, in conjunction with Functional stakeholders and SMEs; manage price optimization modeling and maintenance Qualifications: Minimum five years of recent experience in professional services in a strategic pricing role or related field as well as experience in a business analyst role, preferably one that affects sales behaviors such as pricing, business development, marketing, or sales enablement Bachelor of Art or Science degree from an accredited college/university is required; preferably CPP, MBA or MA Experience with designing and implementing systems that affect sales behavior, such as CRM, SFA, CPQ, Quote-to-Cash; experience with the Salesforce platform, design approach, configuration and integration; revenue Cloud/CPQ is a major plus Experience implementing pricing technologies, either internally built or leveraging a third party provider; experience in developing solution/product visions and specifications, facilitating stakeholder workshops; keen attention to detail and willingness to respectfully challenge group think in pursuit of strategic objectives; ability to engage and interact with, technical, non-technical, offshore and third party vendor staff; strong problem-solving, communication and inter-personal skills Hands on experience in defining solution attribution-based price optimization models and executing the process to elicit requirements, develop functional solutions, design system workflows/UX in Salesforce or related third party solutions, support development resources, prepare test plans, and support deployment and change management plans General knowledge of data technologies, including Business Intelligence, Machine Learning, Predictive Analytics, Artificial Intelligence, and how they can be leveraged in an application and UX design; excellent skills in Microsoft Office Suite including Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook, Teams; experience with SAP or other ERP billing systems a plus KPMG complies with all local/state regulations regarding displaying salary ranges. If required, the ranges displayed below or via the URL below are specifically for those potential hires who will work in the location(s) listed. title: Business Development Representative
description: About Turing Based in Palo Alto, California, Turing is the world's first AI-powered tech services company. It has reimagined tech services from the ground up with AI by offering AI-vetted and matched talent, AI-accelerated development, and access to AI transformation experts who have built many of the most iconic Silicon Valley companies. Founded in 2018, the company has experienced tremendous growth with three million global developers on its Talent Cloud and 900+ clients. Turing has received numerous awards, including Forbes 's 2022 "One of America's Best Startup Employers," being ranked #1 in The Information 's 2021 Annual List of most promising B2B Companies and Fast Company 's "Annual List of the World's Most Innovative Companies." The company's leadership team comprises both AI technologists from leading organizations including Meta, Google, Microsoft, Apple, Amazon, Twitter, Stanford, Caltech, MIT as well as tech consulting veterans from Accenture, Cognizant, Capgemini, McKinsey, Bain, and more. About role: The Business Development Representative identifies and negotiates strategic relationships with current customers and develops new business relationships. Responsibilities: Prospects for potential new clients within our target market: Enterprise business ($1B+ in revenue) looking for Tech Services suppliers Cold Calls to prospective new clients as well as new buying centers within current clients. Follow up and qualify sales leads. Strategizes and executes outreach efforts to connect with buyers who may not be aware of Turing. Makes professional presentations on Turing's capabilities to help solve client problems. Develops and maintains relationships with key customer personnel. Identifies client needs. Provides product/solutions data as needed by customers. Creates opportunities for AEs to work towards closing. Works with Sales AEs and Pod Leads to grow the business. Completes internal reports and paperwork in a timely fashion. Documents all activities within SalesForce CRM Requirements: A minimum of 2 years of experience in professional-level business-to-business sales. A proven track record of successful sales into a technical buying audience (CIO, CTO, IT departments, Software Engineering, etc). Strong cold-calling and relationship-building skills. Excellent presentation and negotiation abilities. Self-motivated with a results-driven mindset. Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a dynamic start-up environment. A strong knowledge of how enterprise corporations buy their products and services Willingness and ability to travel occasionally to events to meet clients/prospects in person. Strong computer skills including knowledge of Google Workspace. Knowledge of SalesForce or other CRM system Advantages of joining Turing: Amazing work culture (Super collaborative & supportive work environment; 5 days a week) Awesome colleagues (Surround yourself with top talent from Meta, Google, LinkedIn etc. as well as people with deep startup experience) Competitive compensation Flexible working hours Full-time remote opportunity Don't meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. Turing is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristics. At Turing we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace and celebrate authenticity, so if you're excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles. For applicants from the European Union, please review Turing's GDPR notice here.

title: Business Development Specialist
description: HelpNotificationsMessagesinfo@seilertucker.comStart of main content Edit the job postJob post has missing information To improve this post, add information that’s important to people applying.Add Job details Job titleBusiness Development SpecialistCompany for this jobSeiler TuckerNumber of openings 1 Country and language United States English LocationNew Orleans, LA 70130Job type Full-time ScheduleAdd optional informationPayFrom $40,000.00 per year Tip: Increase your pay to be competitive Update your pay to $58,801.00 - $64,644.00 per year to stand out. Jobs having competitive salaries are 38% more likely to report a hire by day 7.* UpdateEditShow DataTravel requirementAdd optional informationSupplemental pay types Commission pay Bonus opportunities BenefitsAdd optional information Tip: Use competitive benefits The benefits below are competitive and commonly used across similar Business Development Specialist jobs in New Orleans, LA on Indeed. Health insurance Dental insurance Paid time off 401(k) Vision insurance UpdateEditJob description Job description – Business Development Specialist Seiler Tucker Inc. is an innovative Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A) firm that leverages new technologies and innovation to expedite the selling process power client business. With a proven track record of 23 years successfully selling hundreds of businesses, Seiler Tucker Inc. is a dynamic and fast-paced company that is revolutionizing the M&A industry. The founder, Michelle Seiler Tucker M&AMI, CSBA, CM&AP, CBB, is a WSJ, is a WSJ and USA Today best-selling author of the book “Exit Rich” and an international keynote speaker. Seiler Tucker Inc. is seeking a Business Development Specialist to join our dynamic team. This role is ideal for individuals with a passion for business growth and a knack for developing lucrative business opportunities. The primary responsibilities of a business development specialist will be to prospect for new opportunities, engage new and existing clients who wish to either buy or sell a business, offer clients a range of services including evaluations, business coaching, software, artificial intelligence (AI), and other M&A services. The ideal candidate should have a minimum of 5 years of Business Development working with B2B businesses, display great people skills, know how finding and incorporating new technologies, manage sales pipelines from lead generation to closing 6-7 figure + deals, business expansion into new locations, creating profit centers with congruent revenue streams, networking for alliances and partnerships, and have 3 years minimum business experience particularly in high level sales (6-7 Figure +) with long sales cycles. Business Development Specialist Responsibilities: Develop and implement effective business development strategies to attract new clients and retain existing ones. title: Technology Consultant
description: Deloitte's Enterprise Performance professionals are leaders in optimizing operations that span the entire enterprise of an organization, from strategy to implementation and operation. By joining our team, you can help clients achieve impact and value from their investments in both people and technology that support enterprise-wide operations, as well as solutions for specific functions in the organization, from IT to finance and the supply chain. Recruiting for this role will end 12-31-24. The team Deloitte's Government and Public Services (GPS) practice - our people, ideas, technology and outcomes-is designed for impact. Serving federal, state, & local government clients as well as public higher education institutions, our team of over 15,000+ professionals brings fresh perspective to help clients anticipate disruption, reimagine the possible, and fulfill their mission promise. The Technology Services Optimization Offering works with clients to transform their technology services and operations and provide enterprise-wide service transformation using ServiceNow. Working with Chief Information Officers, Technology Executives, Service Owners (HR, IT, Customer, Field Service, Project Portfolio Management) and their teams, they help to establish an operating model for technology, attentive to NextGen and advanced technologies, new and evolving service models for technology and the operational expectations of an organization. The opportunity: The GPS practice is seeking strong government consulting professionals to support clients looking to modernize and transform IT operations within their organizations. Our multi-faceted approach to solving our clients' biggest problems incorporates a suite of technology tools and accelerators, frameworks, and team members with broad backgrounds and experience to bring results to our client. GPS practice is seeking strong government consulting professionals to support clients looking to modernize and transform IT operations within their organizations. As a Deloitte professional, you will d rive the improvement of digitally enabled organizations by conducting any of the following: Assess the overall health of an IT organization and define related transformation roadmaps Analyze and find suitable IT operating models, as well as define IT operating model roadmaps Analyze IT spend and resources, implement service-based allocation model, as well as oversee cost reduction programs Conduct ITSM Process Assessment, define Service Based Operating Model, and develop ITSM capabilities roadmaps Leverage IT best practices, standard frameworks such as: Gartner TIME Model, ITIL, TOGAF, DODAF as well as develop familiarity with Technology Business Management (TBM) and broader firm alliances and domain experience accelerators. Your Key Responsibilities: Collaborate with clients to develop transformation visions through labs and workshops, and develop business cases for change Design and implement enterprise operating model transformation strategies for our clients in the Federal, State, Local and Higher Ed sectors Perform analytics on client's current state across multiple dimensions including costs, efficiencies, effectiveness, people, process, technologies to identify opportunities for improvement / transformation Integrate our latest tools and capabilities in shared services, enterprise services management, automation, digital, customer experience to help clients transform their mission support functions Conduct analysis to determine the optimal distribution of work and services across the organization Assess enterprise capability maturity, design future-state operating models, plan for enterprise service transformations, and integrate cross-functional work streams during implementation Conduct organization mature assessments using standard maturity models/standards Implement digital tools and accelerators to drive efficiency Identify opportunities for efficiencies in work process and innovative approaches to completing scope of work Coordinate service management, vendor management, governance, charge back models, SLA concepts for centralized services Participate in team problem solving efforts and offer ideas to solve client issues Provide financial analysis/budget formulation to support on transformation initiatives Conduct analysis on large data sets to support recommendations Maintain responsibility for completion and accuracy of work products Conduct relevant research, data analysis, and create reports Assist in proposal development, as requested Actively expand consulting skills and professional development through training courses, mentoring, and daily interaction with clients To qualify for the role, you must have: Bachelor's degree 2+ years of relevant consulting or industry experience in operating model transformations, agency optimization strategies, efficiency/effectiveness assessments, analytics, program management, financial analysis, strategic initiatives Ability to travel up to 25%, on average, based on the work you do and the clients and industries/sectors you serve Ability to maintain a required Federal Security Clearance for this role Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future Ideally, you'll also have (Preferred for SC only): Prior professional services or federal consulting experience Proven experience effectively prioritizing workload to meet deadlines and work objectives Demonstrated ability to write clearly, succinctly, and in a manner that appeals to a wide audience Proficiency in word processing, spreadsheet, and presentation creation tools, as well as Internet research tools Demonstrated understanding of the way tech (e.g., RPA, AI, ServiceNow, etc.) can support improved service delivery Skills/tools (preferred, not required) Microsoft (MS) Office suite MS Project Apptio ServiceNow Certifications (preferred, not required) PMP ITIL SAFe TBM The wage range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. At Deloitte, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is $80,550 to $134,250. #LI-AB6

title: Optimization Manager
description: Known for being a great place to work and build a career, KPMG provides audit, tax and advisory services for organizations in today’s most important industries. Our growth is driven by delivering real results for our clients. It’s also enabled by our culture, which encourages individual development, embraces an inclusive environment, rewards innovative excellence and supports our communities. With qualities like those, it’s no wonder we’re consistently ranked among the best companies to work for by Fortune Magazine, Consulting Magazine, Working Mother Magazine, Diversity Inc. and others. If you’re as passionate about your future as we are, join our team. KPMG is currently seeking a Manager, Price Optimization Strategy to join our Growth and Strategy organization. Responsibilities: Support the pricing value-based and offer configuration programs, critical to managing our overall firmwide efforts to transition away from time & material pricing and deliver value-oriented market strategies which includes content creation and management, overseeing the value benefit analytics process, managing the overall conversion effort, x-functional stakeholder alignment, x-functional team leadership Assist in the engagement-level deal modeling and financial schedules for performance based pricing, subscription SaaS pricing models and other alternative pricing methods; follow the direction of the Pricing & Commercial Enablement organization, responsible for leading function and service unit leadership through the strategic plans and processes; prepare content for Function leaders, Management Committee consumption and other executive leadership communications Contribute to product vision & roadmap; help with the evaluation of pricing/CPQ vendor solutions and overall architecture Engage in stakeholder workshops to understand current state and explore future state, capture functional requirements, design and present concepts, design processes, workflows and UX, conduct usability testing, develop technical specifications, support development/configuration teams, develop test plans and scripts, support deployment approach Lead the definition of pricing optimization and solution attributes, in conjunction with Functional stakeholders and SMEs; manage price optimization modeling and maintenance Qualifications: Minimum five years of recent experience in professional services in a strategic pricing role or related field as well as experience in a business analyst role, preferably one that affects sales behaviors such as pricing, business development, marketing, or sales enablement Bachelor of Art or Science degree from an accredited college/university is required; preferably CPP, MBA or MA Experience with designing and implementing systems that affect sales behavior, such as CRM, SFA, CPQ, Quote-to-Cash; experience with the Salesforce platform, design approach, configuration and integration; revenue Cloud/CPQ is a major plus Experience implementing pricing technologies, either internally built or leveraging a third party provider; experience in developing solution/product visions and specifications, facilitating stakeholder workshops; keen attention to detail and willingness to respectfully challenge group think in pursuit of strategic objectives; ability to engage and interact with, technical, non-technical, offshore and third party vendor staff; strong problem-solving, communication and inter-personal skills Hands on experience in defining solution attribution-based price optimization models and executing the process to elicit requirements, develop functional solutions, design system workflows/UX in Salesforce or related third party solutions, support development resources, prepare test plans, and support deployment and change management plans General knowledge of data technologies, including Business Intelligence, Machine Learning, Predictive Analytics, Artificial Intelligence, and how they can be leveraged in an application and UX design; excellent skills in Microsoft Office Suite including Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook, Teams; experience with SAP or other ERP billing systems a plus KPMG complies with all local/state regulations regarding displaying salary ranges. If required, the ranges displayed below or via the URL below are specifically for those potential hires who will work in the location(s) listed. Any offered salary is determined based on relevant factors such as applicant's skills, job responsibilities, prior relevant experience, certain degrees and certifications and market considerations. In addition, the firm is proud to offer a comprehensive, competitive benefits package, with options designed to help you make the best decisions for yourself, your family, and your lifestyle. Available benefits are based on eligibility. Our Total Rewards package includes a variety of medical and dental plans, vision coverage, disability and life insurance, 401(k) plans, and a robust suite of personal well-being benefits to support your mental health. Depending on job classification, standard work hours, and years of service, KPMG provides Personal Time Off per fiscal year. Additionally, each year the firm publishes a calendar of holidays to be observed during the year and provides two firmwide breaks each year where employees will not be required to use Personal Time Off; one is at year end and the other is around the July 4th holiday. Additional details about our benefits can be found towards the bottom of our KPMG US Careers site at “Benefits & How We Work”. Honolulu Salary Range: Low: $101200 - High: $187000 Follow this link to obtain salary ranges by city outside of CA: https://www.kpmg.us/work-for-kpmg/pay-transparency.html/?id=1776-9 KPMG LLP (the U.S. member firm of KPMG International) offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package. KPMG is an affirmative action-equal opportunity employer. KPMG complies with all applicable federal, state and local laws regarding recruitment and hiring. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship status, disability, protected veteran status, or any other category protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. The attached link contains further information regarding the firm's compliance with federal, state and local recruitment and hiring laws. No phone calls or agencies please. KPMG recruits on a rolling basis. Candidates are considered as they apply, until the opportunity is filled. Candidates are encouraged to apply expeditiously to any role(s) for which they are qualified that is also of interest to them. KPMG does not currently require partners or employees to be fully vaccinated or test negative for COVID-19 in order to go to KPMG offices, client sites or KPMG events, except when mandated by federal, state or local law. In some circumstances, clients also may require proof of vaccination or testing (e.g., to go to the client site).

title: Business Development Representative
description: About Turing Based in Palo Alto, California, Turing is the world's first AI-powered tech services company. It has reimagined tech services from the ground up with AI by offering AI-vetted and matched talent, AI-accelerated development, and access to AI transformation experts who have built many of the most iconic Silicon Valley companies. Founded in 2018, the company has experienced tremendous growth with three million global developers on its Talent Cloud and 900+ clients. Turing has received numerous awards, including Forbes 's 2022 "One of America's Best Startup Employers," being ranked #1 in The Information 's 2021 Annual List of most promising B2B Companies and Fast Company 's "Annual List of the World's Most Innovative Companies." The company's leadership team comprises both AI technologists from leading organizations including Meta, Google, Microsoft, Apple, Amazon, Twitter, Stanford, Caltech, MIT as well as tech consulting veterans from Accenture, Cognizant, Capgemini, McKinsey, Bain, and more. About role: The Business Development Representative identifies and negotiates strategic relationships with current customers and develops new business relationships. Responsibilities: Prospects for potential new clients within our target market: Enterprise business ($1B+ in revenue) looking for Tech Services suppliers Cold Calls to prospective new clients as well as new buying centers within current clients. Follow up and qualify sales leads. Strategizes and executes outreach efforts to connect with buyers who may not be aware of Turing. Makes professional presentations on Turing's capabilities to help solve client problems. Develops and maintains relationships with key customer personnel. Identifies client needs. Provides product/solutions data as needed by customers. Creates opportunities for AEs to work towards closing. Works with Sales AEs and Pod Leads to grow the business. Completes internal reports and paperwork in a timely fashion. Documents all activities within SalesForce CRM Requirements: A minimum of 2 years of experience in professional-level business-to-business sales. A proven track record of successful sales into a technical buying audience (CIO, CTO, IT departments, Software Engineering, etc). Strong cold-calling and relationship-building skills. Excellent presentation and negotiation abilities. Self-motivated with a results-driven mindset. Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a dynamic start-up environment. A strong knowledge of how enterprise corporations buy their products and services Willingness and ability to travel occasionally to events to meet clients/prospects in person. Strong computer skills including knowledge of Google Workspace. Knowledge of SalesForce or other CRM system Advantages of joining Turing: Amazing work culture (Super collaborative & supportive work environment; 5 days a week) Awesome colleagues (Surround yourself with top talent from Meta, Google, LinkedIn etc. as well as people with deep startup experience) Competitive compensation Flexible working hours Full-time remote opportunity Don't meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. Turing is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristics. At Turing we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace and celebrate authenticity, so if you're excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles. For applicants from the European Union, please review Turing's GDPR notice here.

title: Business Development Specialist
description: HelpNotificationsMessagesinfo@seilertucker.comStart of main content Edit the job postJob post has missing information To improve this post, add information that’s important to people applying.Add Job details Job titleBusiness Development SpecialistCompany for this jobSeiler TuckerNumber of openings 1 Country and language United States English LocationNew Orleans, LA 70130Job type Full-time ScheduleAdd optional informationPayFrom $40,000.00 per year Tip: Increase your pay to be competitive Update your pay to $58,801.00 - $64,644.00 per year to stand out. Jobs having competitive salaries are 38% more likely to report a hire by day 7.* UpdateEditShow DataTravel requirementAdd optional informationSupplemental pay types Commission pay Bonus opportunities BenefitsAdd optional information Tip: Use competitive benefits The benefits below are competitive and commonly used across similar Business Development Specialist jobs in New Orleans, LA on Indeed. Health insurance Dental insurance Paid time off 401(k) Vision insurance UpdateEditJob description Job description – Business Development Specialist Seiler Tucker Inc. is an innovative Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A) firm that leverages new technologies and innovation to expedite the selling process power client business. With a proven track record of 23 years successfully selling hundreds of businesses, Seiler Tucker Inc. is a dynamic and fast-paced company that is revolutionizing the M&A industry. The founder, Michelle Seiler Tucker M&AMI, CSBA, CM&AP, CBB, is a WSJ, is a WSJ and USA Today best-selling author of the book “Exit Rich” and an international keynote speaker. Seiler Tucker Inc. is seeking a Business Development Specialist to join our dynamic team. This role is ideal for individuals with a passion for business growth and a knack for developing lucrative business opportunities. The primary responsibilities of a business development specialist will be to prospect for new opportunities, engage new and existing clients who wish to either buy or sell a business, offer clients a range of services including evaluations, business coaching, software, artificial intelligence (AI), and other M&A services. The ideal candidate should have a minimum of 5 years of Business Development working with B2B businesses, display great people skills, know how finding and incorporating new technologies, manage sales pipelines from lead generation to closing 6-7 figure + deals, business expansion into new locations, creating profit centers with congruent revenue streams, networking for alliances and partnerships, and have 3 years minimum business experience particularly in high level sales (6-7 Figure +) with long sales cycles. Business Development Specialist Responsibilities: Develop and implement effective business development strategies to attract new clients and retain existing ones. Nation-wide Office Expansion Experience incorporating new technologies into developing new business Experience Starting new profit centers and congruent revenue streams Forming alliances and new partnerships Identify clients/potential partners in which to expand M&A services Build and maintain strong relationships with business sellers and buyers and third-party vendors ensuring exceptional customer service throughout the business transaction process. Setting up and organizing events Collaborate with marketing, sales, financial analyst, and operations teams to create compelling sales materials. Manage the full sales cycle, from lead generation to closing deals, while consistently meeting or exceeding sales targets. Attend industry events and networking opportunities to promote the company and stay informed about market trends. Maintain accurate and current records of all sales activities and client interactions using CRM tools. Work closely with financial analysts, buyers, and sellers to facilitate successful transactions. Discover patentable opportunities Business Development Specialist Requirements: Experience in M&A, business brokerage, or related fields highly preferred. At least 5 years of consecutive business development and sales experience, preferably in B2B environments. Proven track record in high-level business development and sales (6-7 figure + deals). Exceptional negotiation, communication, and interpersonal skills. Building congruent revenue streams Business expansion and new office start-up Nation-wide Office Expansion Experience incorporating new technologies in Experience Starting new profit centers and congruent revenue streams Forming alliances and new partnerships Strong organizational skills with extreme attention to detail. Ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team. Familiarity with CRM practices and ability to manage sales pipelines effectively. Willingness/Ability to travel minimally, as required. title: Technology Consultant
description: Deloitte's Enterprise Performance professionals are leaders in optimizing operations that span the entire enterprise of an organization, from strategy to implementation and operation. By joining our team, you can help clients achieve impact and value from their investments in both people and technology that support enterprise-wide operations, as well as solutions for specific functions in the organization, from IT to finance and the supply chain. Recruiting for this role will end 12-31-24. The team Deloitte's Government and Public Services (GPS) practice - our people, ideas, technology and outcomes-is designed for impact. Serving federal, state, & local government clients as well as public higher education institutions, our team of over 15,000+ professionals brings fresh perspective to help clients anticipate disruption, reimagine the possible, and fulfill their mission promise. The Technology Services Optimization Offering works with clients to transform their technology services and operations and provide enterprise-wide service transformation using ServiceNow. Working with Chief Information Officers, Technology Executives, Service Owners (HR, IT, Customer, Field Service, Project Portfolio Management) and their teams, they help to establish an operating model for technology, attentive to NextGen and advanced technologies, new and evolving service models for technology and the operational expectations of an organization. The opportunity: The GPS practice is seeking strong government consulting professionals to support clients looking to modernize and transform IT operations within their organizations. Our multi-faceted approach to solving our clients' biggest problems incorporates a suite of technology tools and accelerators, frameworks, and team members with broad backgrounds and experience to bring results to our client. GPS practice is seeking strong government consulting professionals to support clients looking to modernize and transform IT operations within their organizations. As a Deloitte professional, you will d rive the improvement of digitally enabled organizations by conducting any of the following: Assess the overall health of an IT organization and define related transformation roadmaps Analyze and find suitable IT operating models, as well as define IT operating model roadmaps Analyze IT spend and resources, implement service-based allocation model, as well as oversee cost reduction programs Conduct ITSM Process Assessment, define Service Based Operating Model, and develop ITSM capabilities roadmaps Leverage IT best practices, standard frameworks such as: Gartner TIME Model, ITIL, TOGAF, DODAF as well as develop familiarity with Technology Business Management (TBM) and broader firm alliances and domain experience accelerators. Your Key Responsibilities: Collaborate with clients to develop transformation visions through labs and workshops, and develop business cases for change Design and implement enterprise operating model transformation strategies for our clients in the Federal, State, Local and Higher Ed sectors Perform analytics on client's current state across multiple dimensions including costs, efficiencies, effectiveness, people, process, technologies to identify opportunities for improvement / transformation Integrate our latest tools and capabilities in shared services, enterprise services management, automation, digital, customer experience to help clients transform their mission support functions Conduct analysis to determine the optimal distribution of work and services across the organization Assess enterprise capability maturity, design future-state operating models, plan for enterprise service transformations, and integrate cross-functional work streams during implementation Conduct organization mature assessments using standard maturity models/standards Implement digital tools and accelerators to drive efficiency Identify opportunities for efficiencies in work process and innovative approaches to completing scope of work Coordinate service management, vendor management, governance, charge back models, SLA concepts for centralized services Participate in team problem solving efforts and offer ideas to solve client issues Provide financial analysis/budget formulation to support on transformation initiatives Conduct analysis on large data sets to support recommendations Maintain responsibility for completion and accuracy of work products Conduct relevant research, data analysis, and create reports Assist in proposal development, as requested Actively expand consulting skills and professional development through training courses, mentoring, and daily interaction with clients To qualify for the role, you must have: Bachelor's degree 2+ years of relevant consulting or industry experience in operating model transformations, agency optimization strategies, efficiency/effectiveness assessments, analytics, program management, financial analysis, strategic initiatives Ability to travel up to 25%, on average, based on the work you do and the clients and industries/sectors you serve Ability to maintain a required Federal Security Clearance for this role Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future Ideally, you'll also have (Preferred for SC only): Prior professional services or federal consulting experience Proven experience effectively prioritizing workload to meet deadlines and work objectives Demonstrated ability to write clearly, succinctly, and in a manner that appeals to a wide audience Proficiency in word processing, spreadsheet, and presentation creation tools, as well as Internet research tools Demonstrated understanding of the way tech (e.g., RPA, AI, ServiceNow, etc.) can support improved service delivery Skills/tools (preferred, not required) Microsoft (MS) Office suite MS Project Apptio ServiceNow Certifications (preferred, not required) PMP ITIL SAFe TBM The wage range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. At Deloitte, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is $80,550 to $134,250. #LI-AB6

title: Optimization Manager
description: Known for being a great place to work and build a career, KPMG provides audit, tax and advisory services for organizations in today’s most important industries. Our growth is driven by delivering real results for our clients. It’s also enabled by our culture, which encourages individual development, embraces an inclusive environment, rewards innovative excellence and supports our communities. With qualities like those, it’s no wonder we’re consistently ranked among the best companies to work for by Fortune Magazine, Consulting Magazine, Working Mother Magazine, Diversity Inc. and others. If you’re as passionate about your future as we are, join our team. KPMG is currently seeking a Manager, Price Optimization Strategy to join our Growth and Strategy organization. Responsibilities: Support the pricing value-based and offer configuration programs, critical to managing our overall firmwide efforts to transition away from time & material pricing and deliver value-oriented market strategies which includes content creation and management, overseeing the value benefit analytics process, managing the overall conversion effort, x-functional stakeholder alignment, x-functional team leadership Assist in the engagement-level deal modeling and financial schedules for performance based pricing, subscription SaaS pricing models and other alternative pricing methods; follow the direction of the Pricing & Commercial Enablement organization, responsible for leading function and service unit leadership through the strategic plans and processes; prepare content for Function leaders, Management Committee consumption and other executive leadership communications Contribute to product vision & roadmap; help with the evaluation of pricing/CPQ vendor solutions and overall architecture Engage in stakeholder workshops to understand current state and explore future state, capture functional requirements, design and present concepts, design processes, workflows and UX, conduct usability testing, develop technical specifications, support development/configuration teams, develop test plans and scripts, support deployment approach Lead the definition of pricing optimization and solution attributes, in conjunction with Functional stakeholders and SMEs; manage price optimization modeling and maintenance Qualifications: Minimum five years of recent experience in professional services in a strategic pricing role or related field as well as experience in a business analyst role, preferably one that affects sales behaviors such as pricing, business development, marketing, or sales enablement Bachelor of Art or Science degree from an accredited college/university is required; preferably CPP, MBA or MA Experience with designing and implementing systems that affect sales behavior, such as CRM, SFA, CPQ, Quote-to-Cash; experience with the Salesforce platform, design approach, configuration and integration; revenue Cloud/CPQ is a major plus Experience implementing pricing technologies, either internally built or leveraging a third party provider; experience in developing solution/product visions and specifications, facilitating stakeholder workshops; keen attention to detail and willingness to respectfully challenge group think in pursuit of strategic objectives; ability to engage and interact with, technical, non-technical, offshore and third party vendor staff; strong problem-solving, communication and inter-personal skills Hands on experience in defining solution attribution-based price optimization models and executing the process to elicit requirements, develop functional solutions, design system workflows/UX in Salesforce or related third party solutions, support development resources, prepare test plans, and support deployment and change management plans General knowledge of data technologies, including Business Intelligence, Machine Learning, Predictive Analytics, Artificial Intelligence, and how they can be leveraged in an application and UX design; excellent skills in Microsoft Office Suite including Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook, Teams; experience with SAP or other ERP billing systems a plus KPMG complies with all local/state regulations regarding displaying salary ranges. If required, the ranges displayed below or via the URL below are specifically for those potential hires who will work in the location(s) listed. Any offered salary is determined based on relevant factors such as applicant's skills, job responsibilities, prior relevant experience, certain degrees and certifications and market considerations. In addition, the firm is proud to offer a comprehensive, competitive benefits package, with options designed to help you make the best decisions for yourself, your family, and your lifestyle. Available benefits are based on eligibility. Our Total Rewards package includes a variety of medical and dental plans, vision coverage, disability and life insurance, 401(k) plans, and a robust suite of personal well-being benefits to support your mental health. Depending on job classification, standard work hours, and years of service, KPMG provides Personal Time Off per fiscal year. Additionally, each year the firm publishes a calendar of holidays to be observed during the year and provides two firmwide breaks each year where employees will not be required to use Personal Time Off; one is at year end and the other is around the July 4th holiday. Additional details about our benefits can be found towards the bottom of our KPMG US Careers site at “Benefits & How We Work”. The attached link contains further information regarding the firm's compliance with federal, state and local recruitment and hiring laws. No phone calls or agencies please. Candidates are encouraged to apply expeditiously to any role(s) for which they are qualified that is also of interest to them. title: Optimization Manager
description: Known for being a great place to work and build a career, KPMG provides audit, tax and advisory services for organizations in today’s most important industries. Our growth is driven by delivering real results for our clients. It’s also enabled by our culture, which encourages individual development, embraces an inclusive environment, rewards innovative excellence and supports our communities. With qualities like those, it’s no wonder we’re consistently ranked among the best companies to work for by Fortune Magazine, Consulting Magazine, Working Mother Magazine, Diversity Inc. and others. If you’re as passionate about your future as we are, join our team. KPMG is currently seeking a Manager, Price Optimization Strategy to join our Growth and Strategy organization. Responsibilities: Support the pricing value-based and offer configuration programs, critical to managing our overall firmwide efforts to transition away from time & material pricing and deliver value-oriented market strategies which includes content creation and management, overseeing the value benefit analytics process, managing the overall conversion effort, x-functional stakeholder alignment, x-functional team leadership Assist in the engagement-level deal modeling and financial schedules for performance based pricing, subscription SaaS pricing models and other alternative pricing methods; follow the direction of the Pricing & Commercial Enablement organization, responsible for leading function and service unit leadership through the strategic plans and processes; prepare content for Function leaders, Management Committee consumption and other executive leadership communications Contribute to product vision & roadmap; help with the evaluation of pricing/CPQ vendor solutions and overall architecture Engage in stakeholder workshops to understand current state and explore future state, capture functional requirements, design and present concepts, design processes, workflows and UX, conduct usability testing, develop technical specifications, support development/configuration teams, develop test plans and scripts, support deployment approach Lead the definition of pricing optimization and solution attributes, in conjunction with Functional stakeholders and SMEs; manage price optimization modeling and maintenance Qualifications: Minimum five years of recent experience in professional services in a strategic pricing role or related field as well as experience in a business analyst role, preferably one that affects sales behaviors such as pricing, business development, marketing, or sales enablement Bachelor of Art or Science degree from an accredited college/university is required; preferably CPP, MBA or MA Experience with designing and implementing systems that affect sales behavior, such as CRM, SFA, CPQ, Quote-to-Cash; experience with the Salesforce platform, design approach, configuration and integration; revenue Cloud/CPQ is a major plus Experience implementing pricing technologies, either internally built or leveraging a third party provider; experience in developing solution/product visions and specifications, facilitating stakeholder workshops; keen attention to detail and willingness to respectfully challenge group think in pursuit of strategic objectives; ability to engage and interact with, technical, non-technical, offshore and third party vendor staff; strong problem-solving, communication and inter-personal skills Hands on experience in defining solution attribution-based price optimization models and executing the process to elicit requirements, develop functional solutions, design system workflows/UX in Salesforce or related third party solutions, support development resources, prepare test plans, and support deployment and change management plans General knowledge of data technologies, including Business Intelligence, Machine Learning, Predictive Analytics, Artificial Intelligence, and how they can be leveraged in an application and UX design; excellent skills in Microsoft Office Suite including Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook, Teams; experience with SAP or other ERP billing systems a plus KPMG complies with all local/state regulations regarding displaying salary ranges. If required, the ranges displayed below or via the URL below are specifically for those potential hires who will work in the location(s) listed. Any offered salary is determined based on relevant factors such as applicant's skills, job responsibilities, prior relevant experience, certain degrees and certifications and market considerations. In addition, the firm is proud to offer a comprehensive, competitive benefits package, with options designed to help you make the best decisions for yourself, your family, and your lifestyle. Our Total Rewards package includes a variety of medical and dental plans, vision coverage, disability and life insurance, 401(k) plans, and a robust suite of personal well-being benefits to support your mental health. Responsibilities: Support the pricing value-based and offer configuration programs, critical to managing our overall firmwide efforts to transition away from time & material pricing and deliver value-oriented market strategies which includes content creation and management, overseeing the value benefit analytics process, managing the overall conversion effort, x-functional stakeholder alignment, x-functional team leadership Assist in the engagement-level deal modeling and financial schedules for performance based pricing, subscription SaaS pricing models and other alternative pricing methods; follow the direction of the Pricing & Commercial Enablement organization, responsible for leading function and service unit leadership through the strategic plans and processes; prepare content for Function leaders, Management Committee consumption and other executive leadership communications Contribute to product vision & roadmap; help with the evaluation of pricing/CPQ vendor solutions and overall architecture Engage in stakeholder workshops to understand current state and explore future state, capture functional requirements, design and present concepts, design processes, workflows and UX, conduct usability testing, develop technical specifications, support development/configuration teams, develop test plans and scripts, support deployment approach Lead the definition of pricing optimization and solution attributes, in conjunction with Functional stakeholders and SMEs; manage price optimization modeling and maintenance Qualifications: Minimum five years of recent experience in professional services in a strategic pricing role or related field as well as experience in a business analyst role, preferably one that affects sales behaviors such as pricing, business development, marketing, or sales enablement Bachelor of Art or Science degree from an accredited college/university is required; preferably CPP, MBA or MA Experience with designing and implementing systems that affect sales behavior, such as CRM, SFA, CPQ, Quote-to-Cash; experience with the Salesforce platform, design approach, configuration and integration; revenue Cloud/CPQ is a major plus Experience implementing pricing technologies, either internally built or leveraging a third party provider; experience in developing solution/product visions and specifications, facilitating stakeholder workshops; title: Business Development Representative
description: About Turing Based in Palo Alto, California, Turing is the world's first AI-powered tech services company. It has reimagined tech services from the ground up with AI by offering AI-vetted and matched talent, AI-accelerated development, and access to AI transformation experts who have built many of the most iconic Silicon Valley companies. Founded in 2018, the company has experienced tremendous growth with three million global developers on its Talent Cloud and 900+ clients. Turing has received numerous awards, including Forbes 's 2022 "One of America's Best Startup Employers," being ranked #1 in The Information 's 2021 Annual List of most promising B2B Companies and Fast Company 's "Annual List of the World's Most Innovative Companies." The company's leadership team comprises both AI technologists from leading organizations including Meta, Google, Microsoft, Apple, Amazon, Twitter, Stanford, Caltech, MIT as well as tech consulting veterans from Accenture, Cognizant, Capgemini, McKinsey, Bain, and more. About role: The Business Development Representative identifies and negotiates strategic relationships with current customers and develops new business relationships. Responsibilities: Prospects for potential new clients within our target market: Enterprise business ($1B+ in revenue) looking for Tech Services suppliers Cold Calls to prospective new clients as well as new buying centers within current clients. Follow up and qualify sales leads. Strategizes and executes outreach efforts to connect with buyers who may not be aware of Turing. Makes professional presentations on Turing's capabilities to help solve client problems. Develops and maintains relationships with key customer personnel. Identifies client needs. Provides product/solutions data as needed by customers. Creates opportunities for AEs to work towards closing. Works with Sales AEs and Pod Leads to grow the business. Completes internal reports and paperwork in a timely fashion. Documents all activities within SalesForce CRM Requirements: A minimum of 2 years of experience in professional-level business-to-business sales. A proven track record of successful sales into a technical buying audience (CIO, CTO, IT departments, Software Engineering, etc). Strong cold-calling and relationship-building skills. Excellent presentation and negotiation abilities. Self-motivated with a results-driven mindset. Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a dynamic start-up environment. A strong knowledge of how enterprise corporations buy their products and services Willingness and ability to travel occasionally to events to meet clients/prospects in person. Strong computer skills including knowledge of Google Workspace. Knowledge of SalesForce or other CRM system Advantages of joining Turing: Amazing work culture (Super collaborative & supportive work environment; 5 days a week) Awesome colleagues (Surround yourself with top talent from Meta, Google, LinkedIn etc. as well as people with deep startup experience) Competitive compensation Flexible working hours Full-time remote opportunity Don't meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. Turing is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristics. At Turing we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace and celebrate authenticity, so if you're excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles. For applicants from the European Union, please review Turing's GDPR notice here.

Health insurance Dental insurance Paid time off 401(k) Vision insurance UpdateEditJob description Job description – Business Development Specialist Seiler Tucker Inc. is an innovative Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A) firm that leverages new technologies and innovation to expedite the selling process power client business. With a proven track record of 23 years successfully selling hundreds of businesses, Seiler Tucker Inc. is a dynamic and fast-paced company that is revolutionizing the M&A industry. The founder, Michelle Seiler Tucker M&AMI, CSBA, CM&AP, CBB, is a WSJ, is a WSJ and USA Today best-selling author of the book “Exit Rich” and an international keynote speaker. Seiler Tucker Inc. is seeking a Business Development Specialist to join our dynamic team. This role is ideal for individuals with a passion for business growth and a knack for developing lucrative business opportunities. The primary responsibilities of a business development specialist will be to prospect for new opportunities, engage new and existing clients who wish to either buy or sell a business, offer clients a range of services including evaluations, business coaching, software, artificial intelligence (AI), and other M&A services. The ideal candidate should have a minimum of 5 years of Business Development working with B2B businesses, display great people skills, know how finding and incorporating new technologies, manage sales pipelines from lead generation to closing 6-7 figure + deals, business expansion into new locations, creating profit centers with congruent revenue streams, networking for alliances and partnerships, and have 3 years minimum business experience particularly in high level sales (6-7 Figure +) with long sales cycles. Business Development Specialist Responsibilities: Develop and implement effective business development strategies to attract new clients and retain existing ones. Nation-wide Office Expansion Experience incorporating new technologies into developing new business Experience Starting new profit centers and congruent revenue streams Forming alliances and new partnerships Identify clients/potential partners in which to expand M&A services Build and maintain strong relationships with business sellers and buyers and third-party vendors ensuring exceptional customer service throughout the business transaction process. Setting up and organizing events Collaborate with marketing, sales, financial analyst, and operations teams to create compelling sales materials. Manage the full sales cycle, from lead generation to closing deals, while consistently meeting or exceeding sales targets. Attend industry events and networking opportunities to promote the company and stay informed about market trends. Maintain accurate and current records of all sales activities and client interactions using CRM tools. Work closely with financial analysts, buyers, and sellers to facilitate successful transactions. Discover patentable opportunities Business Development Specialist Requirements: Experience in M&A, business brokerage, or related fields highly preferred. At least 5 years of consecutive business development and sales experience, preferably in B2B environments. Proven track record in high-level business development and sales (6-7 figure + deals). Exceptional negotiation, communication, and interpersonal skills. Building congruent revenue streams Business expansion and new office start-up Nation-wide Office Expansion Experience incorporating new technologies in Experience Starting new profit centers and congruent revenue streams Forming alliances and new partnerships Strong organizational skills with extreme attention to detail. Ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team. Familiarity with CRM practices and ability to manage sales pipelines effectively. Willingness/Ability to travel minimally, as required.
